Title: Create core component structure
Description: Build reusable UI components used across lessons and puzzles (dialog, ghost helper, puzzle complete, puzzle footer, confetti, puzzle link).
Acceptance Criteria: All components render without errors; dialog opens/closes with keyboard; components are keyboard accessible.

Title: Implement localStorage progress system
Description: Create client-side progress tracking and analytics using localStorage to save puzzle completion and session data.
Acceptance Criteria: Puzzle completion saves to localStorage; session ID generated on first use; API endpoint accepts completion data; works when localStorage is disabled.

Title: Create Getting Started page
Description: Build the getting-started page with screen reader setup instructions for both NVDA and VoiceOver, including video placeholders.
Acceptance Criteria: Page is keyboard navigable; NVDA and VoiceOver setup instructions are clear and accessible; links to external resources work.

Title: Create KeyboardShortcuts component
Description: Build a reusable component to display both NVDA and VoiceOver keyboard shortcuts side-by-side in lessons.
Acceptance Criteria: Displays both shortcuts clearly; screen reader announces descriptions and shortcuts correctly; reusable across all lessons.

Title: Create lessons hub and Lesson 1 (Basics)
Description: Build the lessons hub page linking to all 5 lessons, and Lesson 1 covering screen reader basics (reading, navigation, stop speech).
Acceptance Criteria: Hub lists all 5 lessons; Lesson 1 is keyboard navigable; practice area works with arrow key reading; both NVDA and VoiceOver shortcuts displayed.

Title: Create Lesson 2 (Headings Navigation)
Description: Build Lesson 2 teaching heading navigation using H key (NVDA) and VO+Cmd+H (VoiceOver) with a practice area of nested headings.
Acceptance Criteria: Lesson explains heading navigation clearly; practice area has proper heading hierarchy; screen reader can jump between headings.

Title: Create Lesson 3 (Browse vs Focus Mode)
Description: Build Lesson 3 teaching the distinction between browse mode (reading) and focus mode (interacting) with Enter/Escape transitions.
Acceptance Criteria: Lesson clearly explains browse vs focus mode; practice area demonstrates mode transitions; Enter and Escape keys work correctly.

Title: Create Lesson 4 (Quick Navigation)
Description: Build Lesson 4 teaching Tab key, landmark navigation (D key), and element lists (Insert+F7 / VO+U rotor).
Acceptance Criteria: Lesson explains Tab, landmarks, and element lists; practice area has proper landmark structure; element list navigation works.

Title: Create Lesson 5 (Forms and Tables)
Description: Build Lesson 5 teaching form field and table navigation with practice form and table elements.
Acceptance Criteria: Practice form announces labels correctly; practice table navigable with T key and arrow keys; table headers announce properly.

Title: Create and embed tutorial videos
Description: Record, caption, and embed NVDA and VoiceOver setup tutorial videos for the Getting Started and lesson pages.
Acceptance Criteria: Both setup videos recorded and captioned; videos accessible via keyboard; captions available.

Title: Create puzzle grid (start page)
Description: Build the start page displaying 6 puzzle room cards in a grid layout with Puzzle 6 locked until puzzles 1-5 are complete.
Acceptance Criteria: Grid displays 6 puzzle cards; each card is keyboard accessible; Puzzle 6 locked until prerequisites met; screen reader announces lock status.

Title: Create Puzzle 1 - The Dusty Attic (Headings)
Description: Build Puzzle 1 teaching heading navigation in a dark attic setting. Solution hidden from visual users, only findable via H key.
Acceptance Criteria: Puzzle solvable only by heading navigation; hidden elements not visually discoverable; timer tracks time; completion saves to localStorage.

Title: Create Puzzle 2 - The Mysterious Library (Browse/Focus)
Description: Build Puzzle 2 teaching browse vs focus mode in an ancient library. Requires understanding mode switching to find the solution.
Acceptance Criteria: Puzzle requires browse vs focus mode understanding; Enter key switches modes properly; completion saves to localStorage.

Title: Create Puzzle 3 - The Winding Corridors (Landmarks)
Description: Build Puzzle 3 teaching landmark navigation in maze-like hallways. Solution hidden within a specific landmark region.
Acceptance Criteria: Multiple landmarks accessible via D key and VO+U; correct landmark contains the solution; puzzle solvable by landmark jumping.

Title: Create Puzzle 4 - The Grand Foyer (Element Lists)
Description: Build Puzzle 4 teaching element list navigation in an ornate entrance hall. Correct link findable via element list only.
Acceptance Criteria: Many links present on page; element list reveals the correct link; puzzle solvable via element list navigation.

Title: Create Puzzle 5 - The Alchemist's Laboratory (Forms/Tables)
Description: Build Puzzle 5 teaching form and table navigation in a dark laboratory. Form fields hidden within table cells.
Acceptance Criteria: Table navigable with T key and arrow keys; table headers announce properly; form submission triggers completion.

Title: Create Puzzle 6 - The Haunted Ballroom (Combined)
Description: Build Puzzle 6 as the final challenge combining all 5 previously learned skills in a multi-step puzzle.
Acceptance Criteria: Puzzle requires all 5 previous skills; multi-step progression feels natural; only unlocks after puzzles 1-5 complete.

Title: Create background images for all puzzles
Description: Create or source 7 dark/spooky background images (attic, library, corridors, foyer, laboratory, ballroom, entryway) in WebP format.
Acceptance Criteria: All 7 images created and optimized; dark/spooky aesthetic; images work as fixed backgrounds; performance optimized.

Title: NVDA screen reader testing
Description: Comprehensive testing of all lessons and puzzles with NVDA on Windows using Firefox.
Acceptance Criteria: All lessons navigable with NVDA; all puzzles solvable with NVDA; no keyboard traps; instructions accurate for NVDA shortcuts.

Title: VoiceOver screen reader testing
Description: Comprehensive testing of all lessons and puzzles with VoiceOver on Mac using Safari.
Acceptance Criteria: All lessons navigable with VoiceOver; all puzzles solvable with VoiceOver; no keyboard traps; rotor shows proper element lists.

Title: Refine focus indicators and keyboard accessibility
Description: Polish keyboard focus indicators for visibility on dark backgrounds and ensure logical tab order across all pages.
Acceptance Criteria: Focus visible on all interactive elements; high contrast against dark backgrounds; tab order is logical; no keyboard traps.

Title: Add ghost animations and atmospheric CSS
Description: Add CSS animations and atmospheric effects (ghost floating, flickering lights) matching the spooky theme. Respect prefers-reduced-motion.
Acceptance Criteria: Ghost helper animates smoothly; atmospheric effects enhance theme; animations respect accessibility preferences.

Title: Create feedback page
Description: Build a feedback form page for workshop participants to rate their experience and provide suggestions.
Acceptance Criteria: Form is fully keyboard accessible; all fields announce labels properly; form validates and submits correctly; success message displayed.

Title: Create home page
Description: Build the home page as the entry point with game title, introduction, and navigation links to getting started, lessons, and puzzles.
Acceptance Criteria: Home page is keyboard navigable; clear path to getting started; matches spooky theme; links work correctly.

Title: Deploy to Vercel and configure environment
Description: Deploy the completed application to Vercel with environment variables and analytics configured.
Acceptance Criteria: Site deployed successfully; environment variables configured; production build works; analytics tracking functional.
